intro: Limeum telephioides var. schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's limeum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
